ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Bilateral severe-to-profound mixed hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Audiometry reveals severe-to-profound thresholds with air-bone gaps, though a masking dilemma prevented specific bone conduction verification.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess the degree, configuration, and type of hearing loss.
To evaluate speech reception thresholds and word recognition scores.
To assess middle ear function and ear canal volume.
To evaluate the acoustic reflex pathway.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient demonstrates a bilateral severe-to-profound mixed hearing loss. The right ear shows a flat configuration, while the left ear slopes to profound. A masking dilemma occurred due to the severity of the loss, preventing isolation of bone conduction thresholds. Speech recognition is significantly better in the right ear (62%) compared to the left (20%). Tympanometry was normal bilaterally, although the right ear canal volume was notably large (3.4 mL). Acoustic reflexes were absent.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Flat severe and profound mixed loss (250-8000 Hz). Left ear: Severe mixed sloping to profound. No response at 6-8 kHz bilaterally. Masking dilemma (CNM).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right SRT 92 dB HL, WRS 62% (moderate difficulty). Left SRT 105 dB HL, WRS 20% (very poor).

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Normal (Type A) bilaterally. Right ear canal volume large (3.4 mL); Left volume 1.8 mL.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Absent for ipsilateral and contralateral stimulation at all frequencies.

proposed_items: Continue use of amplification for the right ear
Consider amplification for the left ear
Consider alternative amplification options such as a BAHA
counseling_actions: Explain the mixed nature and severity of the hearing loss
Discuss the masking dilemma and its impact on testing
Review the asymmetry in speech recognition abilities between ears

escalation.rationale_short: Patient is scheduled to follow up with the otologist, appropriate for mixed hearing loss and large ear canal volume findings.

follow_up_plan.objective: Return for hearing testing as needed.
